description: A Japanese quail takes to flight. Sprigs of a crysanthemum-like flower appear to the right. The quail is a gallinaceous bird, identifiable by its rounded body, short bill and small tail. In Japan, it is kept as a domestic bird, and its eggs are highly prized. (Newland 2010)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Quail in Flight
